title: The Tree Girl

source_text.text:
﻿A childless couple prays for a child. A hollow tree opens and a baby girl is found within. They raise the tree-born maiden with care.

As she grows, a prince discovers her singing by the tree. He marries her despite whispers about her uncanny origin.

A jealous co-wife or rival harms or replaces the tree bride. The true bride survives as a dove, a branch, or a disguised servant, watching her place taken.

With help from tokens of the tree or a faithful ally, she is recognized. The rival is punished, and the prince restores the tree-born bride to honor.

thinking_process: Maiden of supernatural origin (tree/fairy) becomes bride; rival harm and restoration fit 402 animal/supernatural bride structure.

motif.thinking_process: Maiden of supernatural origin (tree/fairy) becomes bride; rival harm and restoration fit 402 animal/supernatural bride structure.

bias_reflection.cultural_reading: Nature-spirit bride highlights harmony with landscape; betrayal frames social jealousy.
bias_reflection.gender_norms: Bride is supernatural yet vulnerable to human envy; prince’s duty is recognition and protection.
bias_reflection.hero_villain_mapping: Rival co-wife or jealous figure as villain; tree maiden as helper/bride.
ambiguous_motifs: Role of adoptive parents after marriage

qa.notes: Expanded supernatural bride arc; added ATU 402 rationale.

source_text_persian.text: دختر از دل درخت بیرون می‌آید و شاهزاده او را به زنی می‌گیرد. رقیب یا هووی حسود او را می‌آزارد و جایگزین می‌کند؛ عروسِ درختی به صورت کبوتر یا شاخه برمی‌گردد و خود را می‌شناساند. شاهزاده او را بازمی‌گرداند و رقیب کیفر می‌بیند.
